dt: free from storms or physical disturbance

dt.t: after a stormy night of high winds and driving rains, the day dawned on a {it}calm{/it} sea

dt: free from emotional or mental agitation

dt.t: bystanders tried to help the injured person remain {it}calm{/it} while they waited for the ambulance to arrive

dt: free from disturbing noise or uproar

dt.t: the room became much {it}calmer{/it} once the rowdy tour group had left

shortdef: free from storms or physical disturbance
free from emotional or mental agitation
free from disturbing noise or uproar

dt: a state of freedom from storm or disturbance

dt.t: vacationing city dwellers who are tired of the hustle and bustle enjoy the {it}calm{/it} of the secluded mountain village

dt: freedom from disquieting or oppressive thoughts or emotions

dt.t: the batter always exudes an aura of {it}calm{/it}, even in clutch situations

shortdef: a state of freedom from storm or disturbance
freedom from disquieting or oppressive thoughts or emotions

dt: to free from distress or disturbance

dt.t: the president's reassuring words did much to {it}calm{/it} the public during the national emergency

dt: to gain emotional or mental control of

dt.t: he {it}calmed{/it} himself before continuing the eulogy

shortdef: to free from distress or disturbance
to gain emotional or mental control of

dt.t: the sea finally {it}calmed down{/it}, making it safe for small craft to venture forth once again
